intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius philippii, commonly known as the Philippi's hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Russia. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, silver- or gray-haired leaves and produces yellow flowers in a single head. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
